title: New Book Offers Collection of Bundyisms
text:
Author Steven Bundy reveals thoughts for readers to ponder over their morning coffee
SIMSBURY, Conn. (PRWEB) October 02, 2015
When author Steven Bundy’s children were about to graduate from high school and college, he gave them a book of idioms, thoughts and sayings he had come up with over the years. Soon, others also wanted to read his words of advice, observations and humor. He finally shares it to the world with the publication of “ Bundyisms ” (published by iUniverse).
This inspirational, coffee table book is full of idioms , quips, humor and Christian principles that readers can ponder and consider. The content ranges throughout various aspects of the author’s life, from bathrooms to bitterness. This collection gives insights to a variety of topics, including soda pop, godly wisdom and indifference. Bundy comments on each saying, provoking further thought.
An excerpt from the book:
“A person who offers words of kindness without acts of kindness is like a barber shaving you with a bladeless razor. It feels good when it’s happening, but when it’s over you still need a shave.”
A fun and motivational read, “Bundyisms” offers provocative sayings that will spark the flame of readers’ thought and send them to contemplate and reflect about life .
“Bundyisms”
By Steven Bundy
Softcover | 5x8in | 236 pages | ISBN 9781491773222
E-Book | 236 pages | ISBN 9781491774724

About the Author
Steve Bundy is a retired pastor and human resources executive. He ministered at numerous churches throughout the Midwest as music minister or executive pastor. In his human resources career, he conducted many training programs and wrote several training manuals. He and his wife, Debbie, have been married for 45 years. They have two children and five grandchildren.
